qas.question: In what year did Egypt and Syria Form a sovereign union?
What was the sovereign union with Syria known?
How long did the union with Syria last?

context: In <a0_0>1958<a0_0/>, Egypt and Syria formed a sovereign union known as the <a1_0>United Arab Republic<a1_0/>. The union was short-lived, ending in <a2_0>1961<a2_0/> when Syria seceded, thus ending the union. During most of its existence, the United Arab Republic was also in a loose confederation with North Yemen (or the Mutawakkilite Kingdom of Yemen), known as the United Arab States. In 1959, the All-Palestine Government of the Gaza Strip, an Egyptian client state, was absorbed into the United Arab Republic under the pretext of Arab union, and was never restored.
